Name: Imhotep
Description: This votive bronze depicts Imhotep seated, unwinding a roll of papyrus on his knees. Wearing the same skull cap  as his father Ptah, the main Memphite god, he is dressed in the long robe of a dignitary. The text, written in two lines on the papyrus, now invisible, no doubt informed the reader of his name and his divine filiation.
